newsitem.title: USA: U.S. breaks up alleged credit-card fraud ring.
newsitem.headline: U.S. breaks up alleged credit-card fraud ring.

text.p: The U.S. Secret Service has arrested 32 members of a suspected Nigerian crime ring for allegedly defrauding a credit card company of $2 million, the Treasury Department said on Thursday.

The arrests were made on Wednesday after a five-month investigation by the Secret Service's West African Crime Task Force. Charges brought against the suspects included counterfeiting and trafficking in American Express cards and conspiring to commit fraud.
The Secret Service, working with American Express security officials, found that two company employees were gaining access to account and cardholder information and providing it to outsiders.
The Treasury Department said the information was used to commit fraud by manufacturing, trafficking in and using counterfeit and unauthorised cards in Canada, the United States and Britain.
